intro: Malvastrum setosum, commonly known as the hairy mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its fuzzy, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pale pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Malvastrum setosum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardiness.
